title: Comparing Sets of 3D Digital Shapes through Topological Structures
segmentation: I'm from the CNR Institute of Applied Mathematics and Information Technology in Germany, Italy and I'm going to present very briefly my poster which is comparing set of 3D digital shapes through topological graph.
Our goal is how we can compare to seen various how we can compare to set of objects.
So it's in his represented as a set of attributed graphs stored in a sentry.
That is, you have objects and we extract the grass.
Then we introduce a virtual node without attributes and then construct connected graph for each scene.
So what we do is to compare with seen analyzing the Laplacian Spectra or very seen trees.
To do that we have used the approach with which is described in the paper of whisenand cocolo bottom vectors from algebraic graph theory.
So for each scene we extracted a feature vector an we compute an Oval distance using that feature vector so.
For further result I'll wait for you at my poster.
